title: Troty_Energy_Research_Facility_Wiki
content: Troty Energy Research Facility, shortened as T.E.R.F, is a test world for a vanilla Minecraft technology datapack created by jona23E. This datapack adds various multiblock machines that enable mass-material manufacturing and processing.

title: WarpCore
content: WarpCore is a device capable of teleporting almost everything across many dimensions. Consumes 10000 MWt per one block in action area. It is inspired by "The Spire" from Portal: Revolution. The main challenge of building a WarpCore is getting 32 netherite blocks. Everything else is obtainable from the storage. Components: Netherite: 32 Blocks (see Netherite Refining Process), Copper Coils, Ancient Debris, High Voltage Conductor Slabs, High Voltage Conductor Walls, Iron Bars, Decorated pots. Guides: FJSAGS and Cookies. WarpCore Statuses: Jfrnrn's warp kis: boom boomed; Warpinuss: working with jongara; chicas warp core: stolen by corkstud; Cooockis WarpCore: in possession of Jongara; Ragn4Rockxs Raging Rock's WarpCore(s): destroyed by ART shot; Ronans WarpCore: unknown; WarpCore Neotheater: destroyed, failure after meteorite hit; WarpCore OK Orchestra (3rd edition): destroyed by ART shot; Corrstud's WarpCore Quasar Outpost: in stasis; WarpCore Aurora: adidas.

title: Hadron_Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a synchrotron-based high-energy hadron accelerator and collider used to create various items using high-energy collisions. It smashes items into other items at high speeds to create new items and is a major part of the Netherite Refining Process. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards; Power Input: Into the Interface; Power Consumption(MW): Length × 16. Build Tutorial Components: Interface (insert/extract items, connect to terminal via lightning rod), Rings (minimum 128 copper/tinted glass rings in continuous tunnel), Terminal (operates collider via Data Connection). Regular Recipes: 1x Slime Block + 12x Coal (75 Base Length) -> 2x Diamond, 2x Diamond + 16x Redstone (80 Base Length) -> 1x Netherite Scrap, 2x Iron Ingot + 24x Iron Nugget (40 Base Length) -> 24x Gold Nugget, 8x Iron Nugget + 8x Gold Nugget (80 Base Length) -> 4x Glowstone Dust, 4x Iron Ingot + 4x Gold Ingot (28 Base Length) -> 8x Copper Ingot, 1x Copper Ingot + 24x Stone (69 Base Length) -> 4x Iron Ingot, 8x Netherite Ingot + 64x Glass (120 Base Length) -> 1x Nether Star, 8x Gold Nugget + 8x Iron Nugget (5 Base Length) -> 8x Redstone Dust, 4x Charcoal + 4x Charcoal (50 Base Length) -> 7x Coal, 1x Slimeball + 2x Netherite Dust (100 Base Length) -> 1x Ender Pearl. Special Recipes: 1x Nether Star + 7x Netherite Scrap (100 Base Length) -> 1x Netherite Upgrade Template (will be removed), 1x Red Bed + 4x Ancient Debris (100 Base Length) -> Placed Bedrock (creates temporary gravitational anomaly). Note: Location of inserted items matters for recipes.

title: Wet_Mill
content: This machine pulverizes fine crushed materials into very fine dust. Multiblock Core Placement: Into the pot; Power Input: In the Conductor Block; Power Consumption: 6MW during operation. Fluid Extraction: via copper pipes below the decorated pot; Cauldrons must be full of water. Recipe examples: Gold Dust -> Gold Slurry; more recipes coming.

title: Electrolyzer
content: The Electrolyzer is an electrical molecule debonder used to convert water into oxygen and hydrogen. Chemical reaction: H2O -> 2H + O. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Please refer to build tutorial; Power Input: Conductor Block on the machine; Power Consumption: Unknown. Build Tutorial: https://imgur.com/gallery/electrolyzer-build-tutorial-LAmKmya (multiblock core block highlighted in green for clarity). Recipe: Water 30mb -> Hydrogen 20mb + Oxygen 10mb (processing time: 100 ticks).

title: Large_Fluid_Solidifier
content: The Large Fluid Solidifier is a lapis-catalyzed mass liquid freezer used for converting liquids into blocks. Technical Information: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the Lapis Block, facing towards the output conveyor belt; Power Input: Not needed; Power Consumption: None; Activation: Provide the machine with the correct amount of input liquid. Recipes: Water (2,000 mB) -> Ice; Mineral Magma (2,000 mB) -> Coal Ore (~34.5%), Copper Ore (~32.7%), Redstone Ore (~13.5%), Gold Ore (~9.70%), Iron Ore (~3.25%), Diamond Ore (~2.99%), Lapis Ore (~2.91%), Ancient Debris (0.3%). Located at the topside of TERF.

title: Music_and_credits
content: Up-to-date music list for TERF map. Upper Facility: Startup Failure (Uproar mashup, Halloween Theme), Overload (Panic Track, Roller Mobster), Freezedown (Malware Injection), Startup (Reconstructing More Science Remix), Successful Restabilization (Battle), OpenCore (Ordinary music, Rare music), Warhead (Sabotage), Self Destruction Sequence (Final Flash of Existence). Lower Facility (DEM): Dark Energy Manipulator (Restabilization - Berserker). Easter Egg Music: Final Flash of Existence, Hyperspace, Jona Kockarosnoy, King of Pipes, Datsu, Vortal Combat, Skibidi, Saas.

title: Fabricator
content: The Fabricator is a machine used to fabricate most of TERF's custom items and tools. Technical Information: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the crafter (highlighted area); Power Input: Behind the crafter; Power Consumption: 100MW during operation; Activation: Put required items into crafter, then press button. Tool Parts Recipes: High-Voltage-Laser-Diode, Low-Voltage-Laser-Diode, Medium-Voltage-Battery, Heat-Sink, Magnetron. Tool Recipes: Tau-Cannon, Wrench, Crane-Remote, Plasma-Pickaxe, Linker, Photon-Cannon, Taser, Laser-Pistol, Multimeter, Dosimeter, Shrink-ray, Neutron-Binocular. Miscellaneous Recipes: Hardhat, Multiblock-Core, Battery, Syringe, Fluid ID. A.R.T. Recipes: A.R.T. rail, A.R.T. gun, A.R.T. hinge, A.R.T. base. Recipe Images: ARTBaseRecipe.png, ARTHingeRecipe.png, ARTGunRecipe.png, ARTRailRecipe.png, FluidIDRecipe.png, SyringeRecipe.png, BatteryRecipe.png, MultiblockCoreRecipe.png, HardhatRecipe.png, NeutronBinocularRecipe.png, ShrinkRayRecipe.png, DosimeterRecipe.png, MultimeterRecipe.png, LaserPistolRecipe.png, TaserRecipe.png, PhotonCannonRecipe.png, LinkerRecipe.png, PlasmaPickaxeRecipe.png, CraneRemoteRecipe.png, WrenchRecipe.png, TauCannonRecipe.png, MagnetronRecipe.png, HeatSinkRecipe.png, MediumVoltageBatteryRecipe.png, LowVoltageLaserDiodeRecipe.png.

title: Netherite_Refining_Process
content: Step-by-step process to make netherite using TERF machines. Initial resources: Honeycomb, Coal/Charcoal, Redstone. Steps include: crafting Honeycomb Blocks, pressing to Slime Balls, crafting Slime Blocks, optionally converting Charcoal to Coal, combining Slime Blocks and Coal into Diamonds, Diamonds and Redstone into Netherite Scrap, and finally processing Netherite Scrap into Netherite Ingots via OpenCore.

title: The_S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R. is a thermonuclear fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility, used to boil coolant into steam. Structure: Consists of 6 stabilisers, an encasing superstructure, and the main core. Core: The fusion reaction core where main processes happen, only present inside superstructure when reactor is in operation, consists of shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core, shield layer has one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields. Case: Sphere-like encasing superstructure around the core, heat transfers from core to case where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines for power generation. Stabilisers: Play crucial role in keeping core stable and preserving core shield integrity. Crucial Components: Breakers (supply DC current during startup/restabilisation, AC input at bottom conductor, DC output from top conductor), Coolant Pump (pumps coolant for S.T.F.R.), Control Panel (operates S.T.F.R.), Mainframe (main computer connecting most machines, finds player IDs, connects/disconnects machines from network), Turbine and Generator (steam directed into turbines to generate power, turbines connected with steam pipes and coolant pipes to S.T.F.R.). Image references: STFRrender.webp, StabiliserRender.webp, Area_render_11.webp, STFRCaseRender.webp, SteamTurbine.webp, ControlPanel.webp, CoolantPumpRender.webp, BreakersRender.webp.

title: The_D.E.M
content: The Dark Energy Manipulator (D.E.M.) is a superradiant scattering type mass to energy conversion device that converts mass into large amounts of power through highly accelerated hawking radiation decay. It is a black hole-based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. Structure: Core (black hole with accretion disc, gravity shield prevents gravity extension), Horizon Scrubber (prevents atmosphere from reaching accretion disc), Power Lasers (stabilizes accretion disc rotational/thermal energy, causes EMR flux), Power Extractors (extracts power from hawking radiation), Stabilizers (stabilizes gravitational shield), Startup Manifold (generates accretion disc). Operation Parameters: Global Laser Offset (4 modes: Extremely Low feeds singularity, Low causes superradiant scattering, Medium warms disc, High adds rotational energy), Global Power Laser (multiplier for current laser offset mode), EMRIR Shield Density (increases EMR flux, decreases gravity shield stress), Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage (decreases accretion disc saturation, NOT IMPLEMENTED), Field Compression Control (increases hawking radiation, NOT IMPLEMENTED), Electron Injection (increases reactor charge, causes lightning at 9000-12000). Crucial Components: Control Panel (operates D.E.M.), Mainframe (connects machines, finds player IDs). Full name: 'Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor' (SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR).

title: Physical_Connections
content: Machines require physical connections: electrical, fluidic, or digital. Omnidirectional Connecting Blocks (input/output any side), Directed Connecting Blocks (input/output opposite sides). Types: Electrical Cables (power), Hot Fluid Pipe (steam, mineral magma), Cold Fluid Pipe (coolant), Data Connection (control panels and multiblocks via mainframe).

title: Arc_Furnace
content: The Arc Furnace is an electrothermal processing unit used to remelt whole blocks into different or more pure materials. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the copper block as shown in building tutorial; Power Input: On top of the coil; Power Consumption: 16MW during operation. Build Tutorial: https://imgur.com/a/FT7tKqH. Recipes: Cobblestone -> Magma Block, Stone -> Magma Block, Magma Block -> Lava, Wet Sponge -> Sponge, Sand -> Glass, T.N.T. -> Diamond Block™, Sculk Catalyst -> Budding Amethyst, Sculk -> Cobweb, Smooth Stone -> Deepslate, Cobbled Deepslate -> Gravel, Calcite -> Quartz Block, Polished Deepslate -> Basalt, Blackstone -> Tuff, Raw Copper Block -> Copper Block, Raw Gold Block -> Gold Block, Raw Iron Block -> Iron Block. To smelt blocks, place them inside the furnace.

title: Electric_Press
content: The Electric Press is a mechanical press used to press various items into other items. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Shown in infobox image (highlighted in red); Power Input: Above top cut copper block; Power Consumption: 1500 MWt every operation; Activation: Each operation is activated by powering the piston. Recipes: 1x Honeycomb -> 1x Slimeball, 1x Honeycomb Block -> 4x Slimeball, 8x String -> 1x Leather, 5x Blaze Powder -> 1x Blaze Rod, 1x Netherite Scrap -> 1x Ancient Debris.

title: OpenCore
content: Furnace using two positron emission units to remelt items 4x more efficiently. Multiblock Core Placement: Into iron blocks at bottom; Power Input: Into conductor blocks; Power Consumption: 1000mWh-10000mWh. Requires active M.C.F.R., C.R.R., S.T.F.R or D.E.M. Usage: temperature orders must be met; failure causes small/medium/large explosions depending on recipe complexity. Recipes: e.g., 8x Netherite Scrap -> 8x Netherite Ingot, 32x Glowstone Dust -> 24x Blaze Powder, 1x Netherite Block -> 1x Heavy Core.

title: C.R.R.
content: The Catalyzed Redstone Reactor (C.R.R.) is a matter conversion reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. It is the second reactor after the M.C.F.R., utilizing Helium-4 that it produces. Components: Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and Projector. Requires constant input of Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls. Startup: Input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB Helium-4 (5% chance of startup failure). Controls: Saturation Extraction Rate (extracts saturation), Catalyzer Injection (increases C. Catalyzer), ™B Projection (reduces Shield Stress by using F. Shield). Emergency Operations: Meltdown (Core Temperature increases Shield Stress, if >100% shield degrades), Stall (occurs when out of C. Redstone or 0% saturation), Startup Failure (5% chance, causes unstable shield formation). Logistics: No Core Temp limit but higher temp = more Shield Stress. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer. Inspired by Anti Mass Spectrometer from Half-Life and Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod.

title: Charging_Station
content: The Charging Station is an electromagnetic device charger used to charge items and tools. It provides a means to recharge various TERF equipment and devices.

title: Diesel_Generator
content: The Diesel Generator is a power-generating multiblock tri-piston diesel engine that provides passive power generation. It constantly generates 6MW while the multiblock structure is intact. Has no stats or controls. Main purpose: Keep facility operational while STFR and DEM are offline, as well as during their startup sequences. Can be used as alternative to STFR or DEM in smaller bases. There are 4 Diesel Generators placed back-to-back with oxidized copper block parts shared in the TERF facility.

title: Extended_Mainframe
content: Extended Mainframe is an unreleased addon which makes it easier to connect Mainframe servers. The addon allows server stacks to reach a maximum height of 5 blocks and allows singular servers to be connected via the sides and top. Glitches: While checks are in place to prevent connecting a server from the sides or top if the server is already connected from the bottom, it is possible to connect a single server 5 times by connecting it via every side and the top at the same time.

title: Fission_Reactor_Lambda_Core
content: The Lambda Core is a fission reactor used to transmute certain blocks into other blocks via neutron irradiation. Technicals: No power input/consumption or multiblock core required. Iron blocks: Absorbs neutrons. Coal blocks: Slows neutrons. Lapis blocks: Reflects neutrons. Control rods: Stops neutron emission when inserted into Fuel rods. Transmutation Recipes: Ancient Debris -> Diamond Block, Copper Block -> Coal Block, Gold Block -> Ancient Debris, Wheat Crop -> Nether Wart, Sandstone -> Soul Sand, Oak Sapling -> Pale Oak Sapling, Brown Mushroom Block -> Warped Fungus, Red Mushroom Block -> Crimson Fungus, Dried Ghasts -> Ghast Tear.

title: Gold_Slurry
content: Gold Slurry is a custom fluid produced by the Wet Mill. Source: Putting Gold Dust into the Wet Mill. Usage: None currently specified. This fluid is created through the pulverization process in the Wet Mill machine.

title: M.C.F.R.
content: The Modular Catalyzed Fusion Reactor (M.C.F.R.) is the first reactor that players make in TERF. It is a regular fusion reactor that generates Heavy Steam and Helium-4 through hydrogen-water reactions. Structure: One M.C.F.R. slab consists of four M.C.F.R. Assemblies. Inputs: Power for preheating, hydrogen input, water input, steam output. Warning: Missing any inputs/outputs can cause over-pressure, ventilation damage, and fatal explosions (explosion size scales with hydrogen amount). Helium-4 can be routed to tank or smokestack but requires proper disposal to prevent suffocation. Startup Process: Need multimeter, fluid ID, and syringes. Add 20,000 mB water, start electrolyzer for hydrogen, connect power cable for preheating (remove when hearing noise), wait for temperature to rise and drop, use syringe to remove water and raise hydrogen temperature. Takes ~30 minutes to produce Helium-4. Recommended Values per slab: 20,000 mB Water, 8,000 mB Hydrogen, 860°C Hydrogen. Maximum Values per slab: 30,000 mB Water, 10,000 mB Hydrogen, 1000°C Hydrogen, 2,500 mB Helium-4. Inspired by HBM's NTM ZIRNOX reactor based on MIRNOX reactor.

title: Machinery
content: This page lists all current available machines on the Official TERF server. Some machines may change over time or new machines get added so this page might not be up to date at all times. Machinery includes: Arc Furnace, Block Breaker, Block Placer, Charging Station, Crusher, Electric Press, Electrolyzer, Fabricator, Fission Reactor, Hadron Collider, Mainframe, Multi Piston, OpenCore, Physical Connections, Purifier, Rolling Mill, Wet Mill, WarpCore, The D.E.M. Related wiki links: The_D.E.M, WarpCore, Wet_Mill, Rolling_Mill, Purifier, Physical_Connections, OpenCore, Multi_Piston, Mainframe, Hadron_Collider, Fission_Reactor, Fabricator, Electrolyzer, Electric_Press, Crusher, Charging_Station, Block_Placer, Block_Breaker, Arc_Furnace.

title: Rolling_Mill
content: The Rolling Mill is an electronic rolling mill used for turning ingots into plates. Technical Information: Multiblock Core Placement: In the center of the multiblock structure, at the bottom, facing towards the output hopper; Power Input: Into the HVC block below the input hopper; Power Consumption: 6MW during operation; Activation: Put the input item into the input hopper. Recipes: Iron Ingot -> Iron Plate, Copper Ingot -> Copper Plate, Netherite Ingot -> Netherite Plate, Gold Ingot -> Gold Plate, Uranium Ingot -> Uranium Plate, Plutonium Ingot -> Plutonium Plate.

title: S.T.F.R._Logistics
content: S.T.F.R. Logistics covers the technical specifications and connections for the S.T.F.R. (Work in Progress). Technicals: Maximum Steam Output: Unknown, conventionally used to generate 30,000 m°C/t of steam. Physical Connections: Coolant Input (requires constant coolant source, recommended to connect coolant pump to steam turbine coolant output for efficient loop), Steam Output (directed into turbines, each turbine handles 5,000 m°C/t of steam), Mainframe Connection (must be linked with control panel in Mainframe), Breaker Connection (connection from breaker output to one of the stabilizers required for startup and restabilization). Build Tutorial: STFR tutorial - multiblock core goes into the end of the bottom stabilizer.

title: S.T.F.R._Restabilization
content: S.T.F.R. Restabilization covers all types of Critical Reactor Core states and their restabilizations. All Critical Core states are caused by failing Shield Integrity. Overload: Usually caused by reactor core stats being out of safety parameters, causes all core stats to run out of control, case burns from heat, core shoots light beams, radioactive particles fill room, if MSSR reaches 0 core explodes. Prevention: Start manual restabilization by replacing redstone lamps with amethysts in stabilizers, press SSTB at console, use Stasis Laser with Netherite block. Manual Restabilization Sequence: Replace stabilizer lamps with amethyst (3-minute auxiliary shield), unlink S.T.F.R. Controller from mainframe, activate breakers (switch power grids if on TERF map), relink controller, replace amethyst back to redstone lamps, press SSTB. Underload: Caused by core getting colder than 8000°C, causes exponential shield stress, core collapses, stabilizers freeze, shield blows off causing unstoppable explosion. Restabilization: Replace 5 frozen glowstone in stabilizer with new glowstone, press SSTB for reignition power surge. Startup Failure: 2% chance during startup, 6 minutes to restabilize, requires 4 stabilizers connected to turbine power grid, power cables on each stabilizer end, maintain cooling line connections. Image references: Startup_fail_connections.png, Frozen_Stabilizer.png, Reactor_underload_explosion.png, Reactor_underload.png, Reactor_melt_Phase_3.png, Reactor_melt_Phase_2.png, Reactor_melt_Phase_1.png.

title: S.T.F.R._Startup
content: S.T.F.R. Startup provides a step-by-step guide for starting up the S.T.F.R. (Work in Progress, written specifically for official map). Step by Step Guide: 1. Turn the key lever on (lever tip must face down), 2. Press the SSTB button, 3. Switch to Reactor grid (go to Main Facility Breakers room for correct configuration), 4. Activate Core Breakers (breaker buttons should change color to black and appear pushed in), 5. Press the SSTB button again (initiates reactor ignition and starts the core). Common Issues: Breakers do not work (can be caused by insufficient power directed to breakers - need at least 24 MW, or breaker output connection not connected to S.T.F.R.). Image references: Breakers.png, FacilityBreakers.png, SSTBButton.png, KeyLeverOn.png. Note: Refer to fan-made Quick start tutorial PDF for additional guidance.

title: S.T.F.R._Stabilization
content: S.T.F.R. Stabilization covers reactor operations, controls, and recommended values. S.T.F.R. Controls: Stone buttons control Stabilizer Offset (increases/decreases core spin), Stabilizer Input (decreases pressure movement from core to case), Power Lasers (increases core temperature), Pressure Vent (relieves case pressure), Fuel Injection (increases core pressure and temperature), Cooling Lasers (decreases core temperature). Status Panels: Shield Stress panel shows Spin Stress (increases exponentially beyond 150,000 RPM), Pressure Stress, Heat Stress, Cold Stress, Ratio Stress. Shield Status shows Shield Integrity and MSSR (Magnetic Shield Stress Reduction - increases by 1 unit per 5,000 RPM). Reactor Status, Fuel panel (Usage, Stored Locally: 69,420, Stored in Core), Waste panel (not implemented), Lubricant panel (prevents maintenance), Capacitor Charge and Reactor Uptime, Heat & Cooling panel (HTR, CR, CA), Generating panel (power generation estimation, MCi radiation). Emergency Controls: Automatic Case Shield Projection (ACSP), Emergency Fire Suppression System (EFSS - currently broken), Core Power Surge. Recommended Values: Core Spin 120k RPM, Core Temperature 90k°C, Core Pressure 200k kPa, Case Pressure 60k kPa, Case Temperature 500°C. Maximum Values: Core Spin 80,000-150,000 RPM, Core Temperature 15,000-110,000°C, Core Pressure 280,000 kPa, Case Pressure 80,000 kPa, Case Temperature 1,000°C. Image references: STFREmergencyControls.png, STFRStatusPanel.png, STFRControlPanel.png.

title: Slangs
content: The Slangs of TERF community terminology: kis = kys but not really, sk = skull, y = yes, X = hard no, s = also skull (chia uses this), UwU = furry, :3 = cat, OH MY FKING GOD = omfg (anthony uses this). These are commonly used terms and expressions within the TERF community.

title: Vent_Block
content: The Vent Block is a block used in the construction of various multiblock structures, notably The M.C.F.R. Recipe Type: Crafting Table. The Vent Block is crafted using a specific Crafting Table recipe. Image reference: VentBlockRecipe.png.

title: Wrench
content: The Wrench is a tool used for changing block rotation states and fixing maintenance. Usage: Maintenance - While the S.T.F.R. is online and there is no lubricant in the system, maintenance may occur requiring use of a wrench to fix it. Hold place block button (normally right click) and point cursor to source of particles, success indicated by hammering sounds and particle source moving. Block Rotation - Hold wrench and activate place block button (normally right click) to change rotation of items, affects stairs, trapdoors, and many other blocks. Fabrication: Requires power source and Fabricator. Recipe: Two iron nuggets, iron pressure plate, iron ingot, lightning rod, and red dye. Item placement locations shown in recipe image. Image references: WrenchRecipe.png (recipe), J6x9G0.png (main image).
